com.yantra.api.ycp.task

Interface registerTaskCompletion

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi

    public interface registerTaskCompletion

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document registerTaskCompletion(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The registerTaskCompletion registers the task in Completed status.

    • Method Detail

      • registerTaskCompletion

        org.w3c.dom.Document registerTaskCompletion(YFSEnvironment env,
                                            org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                     throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                            java.rmi.RemoteException
        The registerTaskCompletion registers the task in Completed status. Each activity group has different validations for this API.

        NOTE:
        This API can take multiple inventory elements to complete the task in one call. The inventory should exist at the source location and should be eligible to complete the task. Tasks should be in Open or Suggested status. For example a task of 10 units for an Item can be completed in one call by passing two cases, each containing 5 units of same Item. Inventory in these cases are passed in separate Inventory elements under the Task element in the input XML. This has been mainly provided to support external implementations like Voice based picking. Otherwise, application always calls this API with single Inventory element.

        PUTAWAY:
        Only Open(1100), Suggested(1200) or InProgress(1300) tasks can be passed to this API.

        Mandatory Parameters: Either target location or target container(Case/Pallet) should be passed.

        Inventory updates: The inventory is moved from the equipment or source location to the target location depending on whether equipment was used or not.

        Exception handling: Exceptions codes of type 'DEPOSIT' can only be passed.
        • Alternate deposit location is suggested for the remaining quantity if all the quantity is not being deposited on the suggested target location.
        • The suggested target location can be frozen for move and/or variance and can be marked as full depending on the exception code configuration.

        Splitting of original task: The deposited quantity can be less than the suggested quantity. In this scenario, new task is created with the remaining quantity to be deposited. The original task is moved to Completed status(2000) with the task quantity updated to deposited quantity. The new task retains the original task status. For tasks other than Putaway tasks, the split task created after partial deposit is in Held status(1400).

        Serial Handling: User has to scan as many serials as the quantity picked if the item is serialized and serial no. is required. If the number of serial no's scanned is less than the suggested quantity, the task is split for the remaining quantity as mentioned         above.

        Target Location override: The user can override the system suggested location. If location type is not the same as the location type of the system suggested location , a new task is created from the current deposit location to the original deposit location. A new task from the current deposit location to the original deposit location will be created in that case also when locations are of type "STAGING" for both the system suggested and the actual deposit locations and these two locations belong to different zones. In all other cases, the task is completed to the new location. On overriding the sort location of the first container of the shipment, the deposit loction displayed will be the overriden location for the following containers of the same shipment.

        Error Codes:
        WMS00009: Serial Quantity mismatch. This means that the picked quantity and the number of serials do not match.
        WMS00063: Both target location and target container are not passed.
        WMS00177: The exception code passed is incorrect for the current operation.

        RETRIEVAL:
        Only Open(1100), Suggested(1200) or InProgress(1300) tasks can be passed to this API.

        Mandatory Parameters: Either target location or target container(Case/Pallet) should be passed.

        Inventory updates: The inventory is moved from the equipment or source location to the target location depending on whether equipment was used or not. If the inventory was picked into a container and the container contents are moving to the same location, the whole container is is deposited, else the SKU is moved from the container to the target location.

        Exception handling: Same as for PUTAWAY (Exception Handling).

        Target Location override: The user can override the system suggested location. If location type is not the same as the location type of the system suggested location , a new task is created from the current deposit location to the original deposit location. A new task from the current deposit location to the original deposit location will be created in that case also when locations are of type "STAGING" for both the system suggested and the actual deposit locations and these two locations belong to different zones. In all other cases, the task is completed to the new location. On overriding the sort location of the first container of the shipment, the deposit loction displayed will be the overriden location for the following containers of the same shipment.

        Serial Handling: User has to scan as many serials as the quantity picked if the item is serialized and serial no. is required. If the number of serial no's scanned is less than the suggested quantity, the task is split for the remaining quantity as mentioned above.

        Error Codes:
        WMS00009: Serial Quantity mismatch. This means that the picked quantity and the number of serials do not match.
        WMS00063: Both target location and target container are not passed.
        WMS00177: The exception code passed is incorrect for the current operation.

        OUTBOUND PICKING:
        Only Open(1100), Suggested(1200) or InProgress(1300) tasks can be passed to this API.
        registerTaskCompletion moves the picked task into completed status. Unlike registerTaskInProgress, the target location is know in advance. The inventory changes done in different scenarios are as follows.
        1. In all situations, the target LPN, if provided, is created in the target location. In the case when a outbound Case is picked into an inventory Pallet, the Pallet is either created or moved to the target location. The outbound case is created on the pallet.
        2. If the task is in OPEN status.
          • registerTaskInProgress is called for the task (Refer registerTaskInProgress documentation for the inventory updates done).
          • If a target LPN is used, the LPN is moved to the target location (registerTaskInProgress would have moved the container to the source location or equipment location if equipment was used).
          • If loose SKU is being picked then
            • If content is not required, the task marked as completed to the target location. No inventory updates are done (The inventory would have already been placed in shipping bin during registerTaskInprogress execution).
            • If content is required, the inventory is moved from the equipment or source location to the target location depending on whether equipment was used or not.
        3. If the task is InProgress status.
          • If a target LPN is used, the LPN is moved to the target location (registerTaskInProgress would have moved the container to the source location or equipment location if equipment was used).
          • If loose SKU is being picked then
            • If content is not required, the task marked as completed to the target location. No inventory updates are done (The inventory would have already been placed in shipping bin during registerTaskInprogress execution).
            • If content is required, the inventory is moved from the equipment or source location to the target location depending on whether equipment was used or not.


        Exception handling: Same as for PUTAWAY (Exception Handling).


        Error Handling: See registerTaskInProgress.

        Error Codes:
        WMS00009: Serial Quantity mismatch. This means that the picked quantity and the number of serials do not match.
        WMS00063: Both target location and target container are not passed.
        WMS00177: The exception code passed is incorrect for the current operation.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This user exit is called before excuting any business logic. If input xml needs to be changed for any reason or any processing has to be done before executing the API, this can be done by this user exit. com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPBeforeTaskCompletionUE

        Events Raised:
        This event is raised upon successful execution of this api.
        COMPLETE_TASK/TASK_COMPLETED

          :This event is raised when task goes to completed status.
          Data published - event xml
          Key data - task_dbd.txt


        COMPLETE_BATCH/BATCH_COMPLETED
          :This event is raised when batch goes to completed status.
          Data published - event xml
          Key data - key data
        COUNT:
        TRANSACTION_ID/ON_SUCCESS:This event is raised upon successful execution of registerTaskCompletion of summary task belonging to activity group COUNT.

          Data published - WMS_COUNT_TASKS_COMPLETE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
          The TRANSACTION_ID is the derived transaction of COUNT_TASKS_COMPLETE base transaction, having current count request status as its pick up status in the pipeline.
        OUTBOUND PICKING:
        SHIPMENT_PICKED:This event is raised upon successful execution of registerTaskCompletion of the last task for a shipment only during Order Picking.

          Data published - YDM_COMPLETE_TASK.ON_SHIPMENT_PICKED.xml

        Template Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Audits:
        An Audit is performed in YFS_TASK_STATUS_AUDIT for task status.

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        An XML document having latest task details and the audit details made to the task status on the platform. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
